page.title: 08Teenage Pastimes in Thorney
page.content: {Thorney}has one{youth club}which is very small. It runs for about 2 hours every Monday. About 12 boys and girls aged between 9 and 15 go regularly. For those older there is an{Ex_Servicemens Club}in Station Road which has a bar and a room at the back for discos or bands. Down the road there is a{pub}called the{Rose and {Crown}which is the only one we have. It's got 4 rooms, 3 bars, and a restaurant. For boys aged between{13 {and 17}there is an{army cadet corps which sends about 10 people away to an army camp every year. They learn about army manouveres.The{scout troop}meets every Friday.The leader is{Bill {Kempsell.}It has been running for many years. There are four patrols named {Stags,Lions,Wolves and Foxes.}They go camping three times a year to{Ferry {Meadows}or{Milton}in{Peterborough.
